intro: Crepis raphanifolia, commonly known as the radishleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and resemble those of a radish, hence its common name. Crepis raphanifolia is an annual or biennial plant that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
